intro: Oncidium × ludwigianum, commonly known as the yellow butterfly orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to South America. It is characterized by its long, pendant-like inflorescences that bear numerous small, yellow flowers resembling butterflies. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are strap-like and grassy, often arranged in a fan shape. Oncidium × ludwigianum requires bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
